edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component

Class NodeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.graph.component.NodeState

  • public class NodeState
extends java.lang.Object
    The state of an Node, used akin to a frame in an animation. As the animation advances, the subsequent NodeState is evoked to be displayed in the animation window.
    Author:
    Jason Cockrell, Ty Devries, Alex McCabe, Michael Owoc

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      GraphState graphState 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeState(GraphState s, boolean _highlighted, boolean _visited, int _id, double _weight, java.lang.String _color, java.lang.String _label, int _layer, int _positionInLayer)
      Constructor for layered graphs; nodes are never added or deleted in this context so there is no need for a separate constructor for the deleted attribute.
      NodeState(GraphState s, boolean _highlighted, boolean _visited, int _id, double _weight, java.lang.String _color, java.lang.String _label, java.awt.Point _position)
      Sets up the various attributes of a node (the work is done by the second version below.
      NodeState(GraphState s, int id) 
      NodeState(NodeState ns, GraphState s)
      This serves as essentially a copy constructor: creates the new object in a different graph state and copies all the information for the node (state) - except, of course, the state
